intro: Syncolostemon rehmannii, commonly known as the mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces small, heart-shaped leaves and has a fibrous root system. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet and bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Syncolostemon rehmannii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
